meanings.definition: To negotiate more successfully than someone else in a business transaction.
meanings.sent1: She was skilled at outbargaining her competitors to secure the best prices.
meanings.sent2: The company outbargained their suppliers to reduce costs.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox outbargained the sly rabbit for the juiciest carrots.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, outbargaining is like winning a strategic game of chess.
meanings.sent5: His ability to outbargain made him the go-to person for all negotiations.

meanings.definition: The act of obtaining a better deal through negotiation.
meanings.sent1: His outbargaining led to significant savings for the company.
meanings.sent2: The success of the deal was attributed to her outbargaining skills.
meanings.sent3: The outbargaining at the flea market was intense, with everyone trying to get the best price.
meanings.sent4: Her outbargaining was so effective that she managed to get a discount on the already discounted item.
meanings.sent5: The art of outbargaining is a valuable skill in the world of business.
